author: Unknown
post_text:
#AI is not just another technological shift. It is a productivity game-changer reshaping competitive advantage. IBM's mission today is to enable every organization to become AI-First. And this week at #ThinkParis and #ThinkEhningen, we showcased how IBM is helping Europe‚Äôs most ambitious organizations gain a competitive edge. A few examples:

‚û°Ô∏è At L‚ÄôOr√©al¬†we are¬†enabling the creation of a¬†custom genAI foundation model for cosmetic formulation¬†
‚û°Ô∏è At BNPP we co-developed a multi cloud architecture to scale in this regulated industry¬†
‚û°Ô∏è At Deutsche Telekom we implemented Concert to accelerate software patch management
‚û°Ô∏è At Atruvia we are advancing automation, data management and operational efficiency

During¬†our Think event in Germany,¬†we also inaugurated the new Technology Campus in Ehningen¬†‚Äîa hub for pioneering tech-- alongside¬†Federal Minister for Digital Affairs and State Modernisation, Dr. Karsten Wildberger and Deputy Prime Minister and Minister of Interior for Digitisation Thomas Strobl. 

The need to supercharge Europe‚Äôs competitiveness has been a central theme this week ‚Äîfrom Germany and France to Finland, where our team hosted EU Commission EVP Henna Virkkunen, who shared her vision for accelerating AI and quantum adoption. These critical conversations surrounded the #EUsummit on Digital Sovereignty in Berlin, where Europe‚Äôs digital future was front and center. 

These are my key takeaways¬†from this highly energetic week:

‚û°Ô∏è Sovereignty must not be confused with¬†protectionism¬†and isolation. It is about building strengths while creating a collaborative ecosystem of like-minded partners on the basis of freedom of choice.
‚û°Ô∏è Competitiveness requires speed and adaptability. We¬†urge the EU to quickly adopt a ‚ÄúDigital Omnibus‚Äù package to remove red tape and show that regulation, done right, can be a catalyst for growth.
‚û°Ô∏è Beyond simplification in the digital space, Europe must create the right incentives to attract and retain talents and find the proper funding for innovation --private and public. 

The path for prosperity is built with bridges, not walls. Let's build an AI-First world together. 

Beatrice Kosowski Wolfgang Wendt Jean-Marc Leclerc

Are you confused about the authenticity of your job offer or suspicious about the recruitment communication you are receiving? ü§î

Here is a quick guide on how you can confirm a genuine job offer and avoid fraudulent offerings from unknown sources:

Verify the sender's email address: ‚úÖ Genuine IBM recruiters will use email addresses ending in @ibm.com. Be wary of any other domain names and spoof emails.

Check the content: üëÄ Scammers often make grammatical errors or ask for personal information upfront. IBM job offers are professional and respect your privacy.

Secure communication channels: üîê IBM will never ask for sensitive information via unsecured channels like text messages or non-IBM email platforms.

Apply via the IBM Careers website: üåê Always visit the official IBM Careers site (https://ibm.co/6045BMnYX) to apply for jobs and check the status of your application.

As global supply chains become increasingly complex, the need for smarter, more sustainable systems has never been greater. 

Earlier this year, the #IBMImpactAccelerator launched a new request for proposals focused on strengthening supply chains around the world. 

Today, I‚Äôm excited to announce the five organizations selected to join this new cohort. Together with IBM experts, they will apply IBM‚Äôs AI, Cloud, and data technologies to modernize supply chains by reducing costs and expanding access to sustainable infrastructure.¬† 

‚úîÔ∏è Al Baha University, in Saudi Arabia, will develop an AI framework to coordinate fleet management operations in real time, reducing idle times, fuel use, and emissions across logistics hubs. 

‚úîÔ∏è NREL Foundation will collaborate on an AI-enabled ‚Äúdata room‚Äù to strengthen resilience across food, energy, and water systems, beginning in Indonesia and expanding across Southeast Asia and the Pacific. 

‚úîÔ∏è Polytechnique Montr√©al will develop an AI and quantum-enabled decision-support tool for Canada‚Äôs forest value chain, improving supply-chain decisions while balancing cost, energy use, and emissions. 

‚úîÔ∏è UNIDO will create a digital solution to assess countries‚Äô readiness for the digital and AI economy, piloting in Brazil and Mexico before scaling globally. 

‚úîÔ∏è World Resources Institute will develop an AI-enabled mapping capability using satellite imagery to detect and classify solar systems, supporting equitable energy-access planning beginning in India, with plans to expand to Kenya and beyond. 

We‚Äôre in an era where advanced technologies like AI are moving beyond innovation labs and into communities, helping to solve real infrastructure and sustainability challenges. This new cohort will show what‚Äôs possible when we combine global expertise with local insight to build stronger, more resilient supply chains. 

Learn more here:

author: Unknown
post_text:
The following is¬†an email that was sent to all IBMers:

I am pleased to share that Jay Gambetta will become Director of IBM Research effective October 1, 2025.

Research is central to IBM. It has been our compass‚Äîhelping the company and our clients navigate the future of technology. Many of you know Jay as a leader in quantum computing, however, Jay understands that Research succeeds when it delivers value not only to science, but to IBM and our clients. He has shown a strong commitment to making Research a driver of impact across our business. Over the past decade, he has advanced our quantum roadmap‚Äîmoving from fundamental science to real systems, software, and services that clients are already using to explore new applications. His leadership has helped establish IBM as a leader in both the science and business of quantum while ensuring it becomes a lasting source of value for the company. 

Jay also understands that advancing science and commercializing technology is a team effort. He has recruited and developed talent. He works with the ecosystem of external partners: universities, governments, and enterprises, striving to ensure they get value from the relationship. He has helped build a stellar team and empowers them for success. All of these attributes will serve him well in this larger role. 

I want to thank Dar√≠o Gil for his outstanding leadership of IBM Research. A passionate advocate for AI, Dar√≠o guided Research to make great strides in AI, quantum, semiconductors, and hybrid cloud. In January, he was nominated to serve as Under Secretary for Science and Innovation at the U.S. Department of Energy, and on September 26 he was sworn into that role. Dar√≠o was a great leader for Research, and I am grateful for his vision, his partnership, and his contributions.

Research will continue to focus on what drives IBM: AI, semiconductors, hybrid cloud, quantum, and the mathematics of computing. As always, Research will also focus on the broader frontier of technology, resulting in innovations we have yet to imagine. 

Please¬†join me¬†in congratulating Jay. I know he will bring the same curiosity, discipline, and collaborative spirit that have defined his career to this new chapter for IBM Research.

post_text:
Top rankings in AI, IT, and Digital Transformation don‚Äôt happen by chance: here‚Äôs what it takes to be part of the team behind them. üí¨

When IBM Consulting was named one of Forbes 2025 World‚Äôs Best Management Consulting Firms ‚Äî it was more than an award. It was a reflection of the people who make it possible.

For 17 years, Karen Demartini helped Federal and State & Local agencies deliver on their mission in some of the most complex, high-stakes environments.

üí° Her top tips as a consultant in the public sector:
‚úî Understand the mission ‚Äì Tie every solution back to people and public impact. This keeps teams aligned and helps stakeholders see the bigger picture.
‚úî Know the process ‚Äì Success is also about navigating what sometimes can be complex and confusing compliance and contracting. Knowing the process as well as your clients helps everyone be successful.
‚úî Never stop learning ‚Äì Government clients are often stretched thin, focused on operations, and navigating red tape. As a consultant, it‚Äôs your job to bring not just IT expertise ‚Äî but a deep understanding of their world: policy drivers, regulatory shifts, funding cycles, and how other agencies are solving similar problems.

üëâ Know a consultant who‚Äôs making a difference? Give them a shout-out in the comments!

author: Unknown
post_text:
Back to School. Back to Quantum. üéì 

One of our favorite beginner projects with Qiskit‚Äîour open-source quantum SDK‚Äîis building a quantum Magic 8 Ball to showcase true randomness.

ùêñùê°ùê≤?
Classical computers use algorithms to simulate randomness, but their answers are ultimately deterministic. So far, these approximations have been ‚Äúgood enough‚Äù to power today‚Äôs technology. But when it comes to securing personal data or sensitive government information, ‚Äúgood enough‚Äù isn‚Äôt good enough.

ùêêùêÆùêöùêßùê≠ùêÆùê¶ ùê´ùêöùêßùêùùê®ùê¶ùêßùêûùê¨ùê¨ ùê¢ùê¨ ùêùùê¢ùêüùêüùêûùê´ùêûùêßùê≠:
In quantum computing, our units of computation, qubits, are governed by the laws of quantum mechanics, which are inherently probabilistic. While algorithms like Grover‚Äôs and Shor‚Äôs can produce deterministic results for specific tasks, quantum measurements remain fundamentally probabilistic, even with complete knowledge of the system‚Äôs initial state.

This true randomness enhances use cases such as unpredictability in programming, variability in simulations, and especially cryptography‚Äîmaking protocols even more secure.

Save and share this project when you're ready to start creating with Qiskit: https://lnkd.in/gcHEKZkf

post_text:
Today I am thrilled to announce that Informatica has officially joined the Salesforce family.

This is a landmark moment for our team, our partners and, most importantly, our customers. By uniting Informatica‚Äôs industry-leading,¬†AI-powered data management platform with Salesforce‚Äôs Agentforce 360 platform, our customers can realize the full power of trusted data with a governed and intelligent data management platform that powers more contextual and autonomous experiences for better business outcomes. 

At Informatica, we‚Äôve always believed that there is no AI without data and that data only becomes meaningful when it‚Äôs trusted, governed and actionable. The three pillars of our strategy, Innovation, Customer Centricity and our Values, have guided us through our entire transformation journey. Now, with Salesforce‚Äôs global reach and resources, we‚Äôre accelerating our mission to put the world‚Äôs AI-powered data to work.

I want to thank our incredible employees, loyal customers and committed partners. Our journey together has always been about innovation, taking care of our customers and belief in the transformative power of data. As we take this next step, our focus remains unchanged - Informatica will continue its mission to help organizations connect, manage and unify their AI-ready data.

We‚Äôre just getting started. The best is yet to come. Read more about the announcement here: https://lnkd.in/gR-EFNMk

author: Unknown
post_text:
üì¢ It‚Äôs official: Salesforce has completed its acquisition of Informatica.

With Informatica‚Äôs industry-leading data management capabilities now part of Salesforce, we are creating a unified and comprehensive data foundation that helps customers deploy agentic AI safely, responsibly, and at scale.

This combination strengthens the entire Salesforce platform:

 ‚úîÔ∏è Data 360 gains clearer, more trusted, and more actionable enterprise data
 ‚úîÔ∏è MuleSoft benefits from advanced data integration and governance
 ‚úîÔ∏è Agentforce 360 gains deeper metadata, context, and lineage for intelligent AI agents
 ‚úîÔ∏è Tableau unlocks richer, more contextual insights from a unified data landscape

This acquisition also extends Salesforce‚Äôs metadata advantage by bringing together enterprise-wide lineage and context across every system, helping customers achieve more accurate, explainable, and trusted AI outcomes.

We‚Äôre excited to welcome Informatica to Salesforce and begin this next chapter of AI + Data + CRM together.

Read more in our official announcement: https://sforce.co/4i9Oy1w
